Entity.description: Represents any entity that can be mapped, such as an OWL class or SKOS concept

category.description: category of the entity. Could be biolink, COB, etc

source.description: the database or ontology prefix of the entity

Entity.title: Entity

Mapping.description: Represents an individual mapping between a pair of entities

comment.description: Free text field containing either curator notes or text generated by tool providing additional informative information.

confidence.description: A score between 0 and 1 to denote the confidence or probability that the match is correct, where 1 denotes total confidence.

creator_id.description: Identifies the persons or groups responsible for the creation of the mapping. Recommended to be a (pipe-separated) list of ORCIDs or otherwise identifying URLs, but any identifying string (such as name and affiliation) is permissible.

creator_label.description: A string identifying the creator of this mapping. In the spirit of provenance, consider to use creator_id instead.

information_content_mica_score.description: A score between 0 and 1 to denote the information content of the most informative common ancestor, where 1 denotes the maximum level of informativeness.

license.description: A url to the license of the mapping. In absence of a license we assume no license.

mapping_cardinality.description: A string indicating whether this mapping is from a 1:1 (the subject_id maps to a single object_id), 1:n (the subject maps to more than one object_id), n:1, 1:0, 0:1 or n:n group. Note that this is a convenience field that should be derivable from the mapping set.

mapping_date.description: The date the mapping was computed

mapping_provider.description: URL pointing to the source that provided the mapping, for example an ontology that already contains the mappings.

mapping_tool.description: A reference to the tool or algorithm that was used to generate the mapping. Should be a URL pointing to more info about it, but can be free text.

match_string.description: String that is shared by subj/obj

match_term_type.description: Specifies what type of terms are being matched (class, property, or individual). Value should be ID from Term Match (SSSOM:TermMatch) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

match_type.description: ID from Match type (SSSOM:MatchType) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary. In the case of multiple match types for a single subject, predicate, object triplet, two seperate mappings must be specified.

object_category.description: The conceptual category to which the subject belongs to. This can be a string denoting the category or a term from a controlled vocabulary.

object_id.description: The ID of the object of the mapping.

object_label.description: The label of object of the mapping

object_match_field.description: A tuple of fields (term annotations on the object) that was used for the match. Should be used in conjunction with lexical and complexes matches, see SSSOM match types below.

object_preprocessing.description: Method of preprocessing applied to the fields of the object. Tuple of IDs from “Pre-processing method” (SSSOM:PreprocessingMethod) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

object_source.description: IRI of ontology source for the object. Version IRI preferred.

object_source_version.description: Version IRI of the source of the object term.

other.description: Pipe separated list of key value pairs for properties not part of the SSSOM spec. Can be used to encode additional provenance data.

predicate_id.description: The ID of the predicate or relation that relates the subject and object of this match.

predicate_label.description: The label of the predicate/relation of the mapping

see_also.description: A URL specific for the mapping instance. E.g. for kboom we have a per-mapping image that shows surrounding axioms that drive probability. Could also be a github issue URL that discussed a complicated alignment

semantic_similarity_score.description: A score between 0 and 1 to denote the semantic similarity, where 1 denotes equivalence.

subject_category.description: The conceptual category to which the subject belongs to. This can be a string denoting the category or a term from a controlled vocabulary.

subject_id.description: The ID of the subject of the mapping.

subject_label.description: The label of subject of the mapping

subject_match_field.description: A tuple of fields (term annotations on the subject) that was used for the match. Should be used in conjunction with lexical and complexes matches, see SSSOM match types below.

subject_preprocessing.description: Method of preprocessing applied to the fields of the subject. Tuple of IDs from "Pre-processing method" (SSSOM:PreprocessingMethod) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

subject_source.description: IRI of ontology source for the subject. Version IRI preferred.

subject_source_version.description: Version IRI of the source of the subject term.

Mapping.title: Mapping

comment.description: Free text field containing either curator notes or text generated by tool providing additional informative information.

creator_id.description: Identifies the persons or groups responsible for the creation of the mapping. Recommended to be a (pipe-separated) list of ORCIDs or otherwise identifying URLs, but any identifying string (such as name and affiliation) is permissible.

creator_label.description: A string identifying the creator of this mapping. In the spirit of provenance, consider to use creator_id instead.

license.description: A url to the license of the mapping. In absence of a license we assume no license.

mapping_date.description: The date the mapping was computed

mapping_provider.description: URL pointing to the source that provided the mapping, for example an ontology that already contains the mappings.

mapping_set_description.description: A description of the mapping set.

mapping_set_id.description: A globally unique identifier for the mapping set (not each individual mapping). Should be IRI, ideally resolvable.

mapping_set_version.description: A version string for the mapping.

mapping_tool.description: A reference to the tool or algorithm that was used to generate the mapping. Should be a URL pointing to more info about it, but can be free text.

mappings.description: Contains a list of mapping objects

match_term_type.description: Specifies what type of terms are being matched (class, property, or individual). Value should be ID from Term Match (SSSOM:TermMatch) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

object_match_field.description: A tuple of fields (term annotations on the object) that was used for the match. Should be used in conjunction with lexical and complexes matches, see SSSOM match types below.

object_preprocessing.description: Method of preprocessing applied to the fields of the object. Tuple of IDs from “Pre-processing method” (SSSOM:PreprocessingMethod) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

object_source.description: IRI of ontology source for the object. Version IRI preferred.

object_source_version.description: Version IRI of the source of the object term.

other.description: Pipe separated list of key value pairs for properties not part of the SSSOM spec. Can be used to encode additional provenance data.

see_also.description: A URL specific for the mapping instance. E.g. for kboom we have a per-mapping image that shows surrounding axioms that drive probability. Could also be a github issue URL that discussed a complicated alignment

subject_match_field.description: A tuple of fields (term annotations on the subject) that was used for the match. Should be used in conjunction with lexical and complexes matches, see SSSOM match types below.

subject_preprocessing.description: Method of preprocessing applied to the fields of the subject. Tuple of IDs from "Pre-processing method" (SSSOM:PreprocessingMethod) branch of the SSSSOM Vocabulary.

subject_source.description: IRI of ontology source for the subject. Version IRI preferred.

subject_source_version.description: Version IRI of the source of the subject term.
